title: Monsters, Inc.
characters: MIKE, SULLEY, GEORGE, JOSH, AND GREEN CYCLOPS

lines.text: Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated.
Uh, my friends call me Phlegm.
Uh-huh. Mr. Bile, can you tell me what you did wrong?
No, no, before that . Can anyone tell me Mr. Bile's big mistake? Anyone?
Let's take a look at the tape. Here we go.
Right... p-p-p-p-p- Ah! See? The door! You left it wide open.
And leaving a door open is the worst mistake any employee can make because...?
Um... it could... let in a draft?
It could let in a child!
There's nothing more toxic or deadly than a human child. A single touch could KILL YOU!
Leave a door open, and a child could walk right into this factory! Right into the monster world!
I won't go in a kid's room! You can't make me!
You're going in there! Because we need this!

Our city is counting on you to collect those children's screams. Without scream, we have no power. Yes, it's dangerous work, and that's why I need you to be at your best. I need scarers who are confident, tenacious, tough, intimidating. I need scarers like... like... James P. Sullivan.

Hey! Good morning, Monstropolis. It's now five after the hour of 6:00 A.M. in the big monster city. Temperature's a balmy 65 degrees, which is good news for you reptiles, and it looks like it's gonna be a perfect day to maybe, hey, just lie in bed, sleep in, or simply (gets very cross, raising his voice) WORK OUT THAT FLAB THAT'S HANGIN' OVER THE BED! GET UP, SULLEY!
I don't believe I ordered a wake-up call, Mikey.
Hey, less talk, more pain, marshmallow boy! Feel the burn!
Scary feet, scary feet, scary feet-- Oop! The kid's awake!
Okay, scary feet, scary feet, scary feet, scary feet, scar-- Kid's asleep!
Ooh, I thought I had ya there.
Okay, Sulley, here we go. You ready? Follow it!
Oh! It's over here! Oh! Look over there! Don't let the kid touch you! Don't let it touch you!
I don't know, but it's been said. I love scaring kids in bed!
C'mon, fight that plaque! Fight that plaque! Scary monsters don't have plaque!
One-eighteen. Do you have one-nineteen? Do I see one-twenty? Oh, I don't believe it!
I'm not even breakin' a sweat.
Not you . Look! The new commercial's on.
The future is bright at Monsters, Incorporated.
I'm in this one. I'm in this one!
We're part of your life. We power your car. We warm your home. We light your city.
Carefully matching every child to their ideal monster, to produce superior scream, refined into clean, dependable energy. Every time you turn something on, Monsters, Incorporated is there.
We know the challenge. The window of innocence is shrinking. Human kids are harder to scare.
Of course. M.I. is prepared for the future. With the top scarers...
...the best refineries, and research into new energy techniques.
We're working for a better tomorrow... today!
We're M.I., Monsters, Incorporated. We scare because we care.
I was on TV! Ha. Did you see me? I'm a natural!
Hello? I know! Wasn't I great?! Did the whole family see it? It's your mom. Ha-ha, what can I say? The camera loves me.
I'm tellin' you, big daddy, you're gonna be seein' this face on TV a lot more often.
Ha, ha, ha, ha. You've been jealous of my good looks since the fourth grade, pal.
Whoo! OK, Sulley, hop on in.
Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, where're you goin'? What're you doin'?
Mikey, there's a scream shortage. We're walking.
NO, NO, NO, NO! My baby! Look! She needs to be driven! Bye, baby! I'll call you!
Hey, genius, you wanna know why I bought the car?
To drive it! You know, like on the street, with the honk-honk, and the vroom-vroom, and no walking involved?
Wa, wa, wa, wa. Give it a rest, will ya, butterball? Come on, you could use the exercise.
I could use the exercise? Look at you! Y-y-you have your own climate .
How many tentacles can jump the rope? One and two and three and four...
Hey, mornin', kids. How ya doin'?
Hey, Tony! Hey, hey, hey! Tony! Pow-pow-pow-pow-pow!
Hey, Tony! Hey, hey, hey! Tony! Pow-pow-pow-pow-pow!
I hear somebody's close to breaking the all-time scare record.
Aw, just trying to make sure there's enough scream to go around.
See that, Mikey? Ted's walkin' to work.
Big deal. Guy takes five steps and he's there.
See ya on the scare floor, buddy!
Hey, Marge! How was jury duty?
Hey! It's still leaning to the left!
Guys, I told you, call me Sulley.
We just wanted to wish you good luck today.
Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey. Come on, get lost, you two. You're makin' him lose his focus.
Quiet! You'll make him lose his focus.
Monsters, Inc., please hold. Monsters, Inc., I'll connect you. Ms. Fearmonger is on vacation, would you like her voicemail?
Oh, hey, Celia... Welia. Happy birthday.
Thanks. So, uh, are we going anywhere special tonight?
I just got us into a little place called, um... "Harryhausen's."
But it's impossible to get a reservation there.
I will see you at quittin' time and not a minute later.
You and me, me and you, both of us together! ♪
You know, pal, she's the one. That's it. She is the one!
Oh, and, uh, thanks for hookin' me up with those reservations.
Oh, no problem. They're under the name "Googly Bear."
Oh, good id- You know, that wasn't very funny.
What do ya know? It scares little kids and little monsters.
I wasn't scared, I have... allergies.
Hey, Randall. Save it for the scare floor, will ya?
I'm in the zone today, Sullivan. Gonna be doing some serious scaring, putting up some big numbers.
Wow, Randall, that's great. That should make it even more humiliating when we break the record first. Ha-ha!
Shh, shh, shh, shh, shh. Do you hear that?
"You hear it? You hear the winds of cha--?" What a creep. One of these days, I am really... gonna let you teach that guy a lesson.
Good morning, Roz, my succulent little garden snail. And who will we be scaring today?
Wazowski! You didn't file your paperwork last night.
Oh, that darn paperwork! Wouldn't it be easier if it all just blew away?
Yes, well, uh, I'll try to be less careless.
I'm watching you, Wazowski. Alllways watching. Always.
All scare floors are now active. Assistants, please report to your stations.
OK, people, Eastern Seaboard comin' online. We got scarers comin' out!
Hey, may the best monster win.
We are on in seven, six,
You're the boss, you're the boss, you're the big hairy boss.
Oh, I'm feelin' good today, Mikey!
Whoa! Attaboy. Attaboy. Another door comin' right up.
You're still behind, Randall. You know, maybe I should realign the scream intake valve...?
Well, Jerry, what's the damage so far?
We may actually make our quota today, sir.
Hmm. First time in a month.
The kid almost touched me! She got this close to me!
She wasn't scared of you? She was only six!
I COULD'VE BEEN DEAD!! I COULD HAVE DIED!
Hey, we got a dead door over here!
Out of the way! Excuse us.
We've lost fifty-eight doors this week, sir.
Oh, kids these days. They just don't get scared like they used to.
Attention. We have a new scare leader, Randall Boggs.
Nice job! You took the lead! You did it! Look at those numbers!
That was awesome! How did you do that? You're going to the hall of fame for sure!
Well, James, that was an impressive display.
Oh, just doin' my job, Mr. Waternoose. Of course, I did learn from the best.
If I don't see a new door in my station in five seconds (rising his voice), I WILL PERSONALLY PUT YOU THRO UGH THE SHREDDER!!!
Hey, Wazowski, nice job. Those numbers are pretty sweet.
Are they? You know, I hadn't even noticed. And, uh, how's Georgie doin'?
He's doin' great! I love workin' with that big guy.
Keep the doors comin', Charlie. I'm on a roll today.
George and I are like brothers.
Red alert! Red alert! Red alert! Red alert! Red alert!
George Sanderson, please remain motionless. Prepare for decontamination.
Get it off! Get it off!
Move, Move, Move! Coming through, please. Stand aside.
Move, Move, Move! Coming through, please. Stand aside.
All clear. Situation is niner-niner-zero. Ready for de-con.
Hey, thanks, guys, that was a close one.
Okay, people, take a break! We gotta shut down for a half-hour and reset the system.
An entire scare floor out of commission. What else could go wrong?
We're just going through a rough time, sir. Everyone knows you're gonna get us through it.
Tell that to the board of directors. James, this company has been in my family for three generations. I would do anything to keep it from going under.
Say, I could use your help with something.
You see, we hired some new scare recruits, and frankly they're... They're... Um... Uh...
I thought maybe you might come by tomorrow and give them a demonstration, show them what it takes to be a top scarer. Huh?
I'll start out with the old Waternoose Jump-and-Growl.
Aaah! Ha-ha! Oh, yes. Now, that's my boy.
Let's go, everybody. All doors must be returned. No exceptions!
Whoo! I've never seen anything like you today! You were on a roll, my man!
Another day like this, and that scare record's in the bag!
So, get this. As if dinner wasn't enough, I'm takin' her to a monster truck rally afterwards.
I'm gonna head home and work out some more.
Again? You know, there's more to life than scaring.
Whew! Hey, can I borrow your odorant?
Yeah, I got, uh, Smelly Garbage, or Old Dumpster.
You know, I am so romantic, sometimes I think I should just marry myself!
What a night of romance I got ahead of me! Tonight is about me, and...
Celia! Ooh, the love boat is about to set sail! 'Cause I gotta tell ya, buddy, that face of hers, it just makes my heart go...
Hello, Wazowski. Fun filled evening planned for tonight?
Well, as a matter of fact--
And I'm sure you filed your paperwork correctly... for once.
Your stunned silence is very reassuring.
Oh, no, my scare reports! I left them on my desk! If I'm not at the restaurant in five minutes, they're gonna give our table away; what am I gonna tell--?!
Hey, Googly Bear, wanna get going?
Uh, do I ever. It's just that... Uh, you know it's...
It's just I forgot about some paperwork I was supposed to file. Mike was reminding me; thanks, buddy. Whew!
I was? I mean, I was! Yeah, I was.
We're going! On my desk, Sulley. The pink copies go to accounting, the fuchsia ones to purchasing, and the goldenrod ones go to Roz.
So the pink copies goes to accounting, the fuchsia ones go to Roz. No, the fuchsia ones go to purchasing, and the goldenrod ones go to Roz. Man, I have no idea what puce is...
Uh, hello? Anyone? There's a door here. Hmm.
Hello? Hey. Psst. Anybody scaring in here? Hello? Yo.
Na na na, zoo yeah out of the look.
Oh, Michael! I've had a lot of birthday - well, not a lot of birthdays, but this is the best birthday ever.
Oh, I was just thinking about the first time I laid eye on you, how pretty you looked.
Mm-hmm. I'm thinking about getting it cut.
No, no, I like it this length.
I like everything about you. Just the other day, someone asked me who I thought the most beautiful monster was in all of Monstropolis, and you know what I said?
No! No, no! That's not what I was gonna say! I mean, well, sure, he's handsome, if you like the big guy, he's rugged.
Hi, guys! What a coincidence, running into you here!
Uh, I'm just gonna order somethin' to go.
I wonder what's good here. Hmm.
Get out of here! You're ruining everything!
I went back to get your paperwork and there was a door.
Wait a minute? Randall? That cheater! He's trying to boost his numbers.
Ohhh! They don't have anything I like here, so take care, Celia!
There's a kid in here! A human kid!!!
Please remain calm. This is not a drill.
We have an 835 in progress. Please advise.
Please remain calm. This is not a drill.
We have an 835 in progress. Please advise.
Hey! Get your hands off my Schmoopsie-Poo!
Well, I don't think that date could have gone any worse!
If witnesses are to be believed, there has been a child security breach for the first time in monster history.
We can neither confirm nor deny the presence of a human child here tonight.
Well, a kid flew right over me and blasted a car with its laser vision!
I tried to run from it, but it picked me up with its mind powers and shook me like a doll!
It's true! I saw the whole thing!
It is my professional opinion, that now is the time TO PANI-!
No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no! Come here, kid!
(gasps) No, don't touch those, you little--!
Oh, now those were alphabetized... It's okay, it's all right. As long as it doesn't come near us, we're gonna be okay.
Hey, hey, that's it! No one touches Little Mikey.
Make it stop, Sulley! MAKE IT STOP!!
Here! See the bear? Ooh, nice bear!
Oh, he's a happy bear, and he's not crying, and neither should you, or we'll be in trouble, 'cause they're gonna find us, so please stop crying, right now, right now...
Good! Good, Sulley, keep it up, you're doin' great!
Oooh, ah, the happy bear, he has no care...
BWAAAAAAH! YAAAH! It touched me!! She touched me! Aaah!
Sulley, the bear! The bear! Give it the…
I have no idea. But it would be really great if it didn't…do it…again.
How could I do this? How could I be so stupid? This could destroy the company.
The company? Who cares about the company? What about us?! That thing is a KILLING MACHINE!
La la la la la la la la…
I bet it's just waiting for us to fall asleep, and then, WHAM!! Oh, we're easy prey, my friend, easy prey! We're sitting targets!
Okay, look, I think I have a plan here. Using mainly spoons, we dig a tunnel under the city and release it into the wild.
That's it. I'm out of ideas. We're closed. Hot air balloon? Too expensive. Giant slingshot? Too conspicuous. Enormous wooden horse? Too Greek!
No plan... no plan... can't think... can't think. Flat-lining...flat-lining...
Uh, Mike, I think she's getting tired.
Well, then why don't you find some place for it to sleep WHILE I THINK OF A PLAN!!
Are you sleepy? You wanna sleep? Is that what you want? Huh?
Okay, all right, making a nice little area for you to--
No, hey, hey, that's my bed. You're going to get your germs all over it.
Fine. My chair's more comfortable, anyway.
It's just a closet. Will you go to sleep?
Hey, that looks like Randall. Randall's your monster. You think he's gonna come through the closet and scare you. Oh, boy, how do I explain this? Uh, it's empty . See?
Well, now there is. But I'm not gonna scare you.
Okay, how 'bout I sit here until you fall asleep?
Go ahead. Go to sleep. Hmm-hmm. Now. Now, go.
Hey, Mike, this might sound crazy, but I don't think that kid's dangerous.
Really? Well, in that case, let's keep it. I always wanted a pet that could KILL ME!!!
Now, look, what if we just put her back in her door?
Mike, think about it. If we send her back, it's like it never happened. Everything goes back to normal.
Is that a joke? Tell me you're joking.

Sulley, I'd like to think that given the circumstances, I have been extremely forgiving up 'til now, but that is a horrible idea! What are we gonna do, march right out into public with that thing? Then I guess we just waltz right up to the factory, right?

I can't believe we are waltzing right up to the factory! Sulley, a mop, a couple of lights, and some chair fabric are not gonna fool anyone. Just think about a few names, will you? Loch Ness, Big Foot, The Abominable Snowman. They all got one thing in common, pal: banishment! We could be next!
Don't panic. We can do this.
Number One wants this place dusted for prints.
I got a good view from here.
This was recovered at the scene.
Don't tell me not to panic. Everything is not okay. It's not okay!
Just keep it together. Stay calm.
Gentlemen, safety is our number one concern. Now if there's anything that--
Oh, hello, little one. Where did you come from?
Ah, James. Is this one yours?
Ah, actually, that's my uh, cousin's sister's daughter, sir.
Yeah, it's, ah, "Bring An Obscure Relative to Work Day".
Hmm, must have missed the memo. Well, listen, James, why don't you stop by the simulator after lunch today and give us the scare demonstration we talked about, huh?
Oh! Sir, uh... today might be a little--
All right, then, I'll see you this afternoon, James. That is, if these gentlemen hadn't shut us down.
Oh, a scare demo. Well, that is great. Why am I the last to know? We can bring your cousin's sister's daughter along. She'll be a big hit.
What the...? Hey! No! Halt! Stop him! Hold him down! Let him go!
Come on, the coast is clear. Okay, all we have to do is get rid of that "thing." So wait here, while I get its card key.
But she can't stay here. This is the men's room.
That is the weirdest thing you have ever said. It's fine. It's okay. Look, it loves it here! It's dancing with joy!
I'll be right back with its door key.
Haha! That's a cute little dance you've got. It almost looks like you gotta--
Uh, are you done in there?
Okay, you're finished now, right? Hello?
Uh, are you done in there?
Okay, you're finished now, right? Hello?
Where did she go? Did she disappear? Did she turn invisible? I just have no idea.
Be relaxed, be relaxed, be relaxed.

Roz, my tender, oozing blossom, you're looking fabulous today. Is that a new haircut? Come on, tell me. It's a new haircut, isn't it? That's gotta be a new haircut. New makeup? You had a lift? You had a tuck? You had something? Something has been inserted in you that makes you look like...
Listen, I need a favor. Randall was working late last night out on the scare floor. I really need the key for the door he was using.
Well, isn't that nice? But guess what? You didn't turn in your paperwork last night.
He didn't... I mean I... no p-p-paperwork?!
Ready or not, here I come!! I'm gettin' warmer, any second now! FEE, FI, FOE-
Uh, um, I'm lookin' for the kid.
Here she is. Hey, what's the matter?
Look, I already told your buddies I haven't seen anything!
Thank goodness. What are we going to do about the child?!
THE FRONT PAGE! It's on the front page! The child! The one you were after!
Will you be quiet?! Don't you think I'm aware of the situation? I was up all night trying to find it!
I did a simple calculation factoring in the size of the sushi restaurant. The child... MAY HAVE... ESCAPED!

Yeah, well, until we know for sure, we're gonna act like nothing happened, understand? You just get the machine up and running, I'll take care of the kid. And when I find whoever let it out, they're DEAD!
Oh! Ow! Ow! I'm not here!
This is bad. This is so very bad.
What were they talking about a machine?
Look, don't panic. All we have to do is call her door down and send her home.
You're right, you're right. We're just two regular Joes on our way to work. We will blend right in.
Did you lose weight? Or a limb? You have her card key, right?
Of course I have her card key. I told you I'd get her card key. I went and got her card key, and now I have her card key.
Take care of yourself. Try not to run through anymore closets.
What're you talkin' about? Of course it's her door. It's her door.
and it had flowers on it.
No. It must've been dark last night, because this is its door.
Hey, you hear that? Sounds like fun in there. OK, send me a postcard, kid. That's Mike Wazowski, care of 22 Mike-Wazowski-You-Got-Your-Life-Back Lane.
Look at the stick. See the stick? Go get the stick. Go fetch.
That's... what I decided to call her. Is there a problem?
Sulley, you're not supposed to name it. Once you name it, you start getting attached to it! NOW, PUT THAT THING BACK WHERE IT CAME FROM, OR SO HELP ME...
Oh, hey! We're rehearsing a-a scene for the upcoming company play called, uh... " Put That Thing Back Where It Came From, Or So Help Me". Heh, heh... it's a musical!
♪ Put that thing back where it came from, or so help me... ♪
♪ So help me! So help me! ♪ And cut. Heh, heh. We're still working on it. It's a work in progress. But hey, we need ushers!
Sulley, I've had enough. Now, say goodbye to--...
Where'd it go? What'd you do with it?
I don't believe it. She got away from you again?! Well, that is just-- Wait a minute, the sun is coming up. This is perfect! Ha-ha! She's gone!
Hey, hey, hey, hey, where are you going?
Sulley, please, don't blow this. Not when we're so close to breaking the record.
Somebody else will find the kid. It'll be their problem, not ours. She's out of our hair!
Can it, Wazowski! So, what do you think of that kid getting out, Sullivan? Pretty crazy, huh?
Word on the street is the kid's been traced back to this factory. You haven't seen anything, have you?
No! No way! But, if it was an inside job, I'd put my money on Waxford.
Yeah, the one at station six. You know, he's got them shifty eyes.
Last night was one of the worst nights of my entire life, bar-none!
I thought you cared about me!
Honey, please. Schmoopsie, I thought you liked sushi..
Sushi?! You think this is about sushi!?!?
Schmoopsie... Ah, ah, ah... Shh, shh, shhh!
It's here in the factory, isn't it?
You're not pinning this on me. It never would have gotten out, if you hadn't been cheating last night!
Cheating! I-- Cheating. Right. OK, I think I know how to make this all go away. What happens when the whistle blows in 5 minutes?
Everyone goes to lunch. Which means the scare floor will be...
Empty! It'll be empty, you idiot! See that clock?
When the big hand is pointing up,...
...and the little hand is pointing up,...
...the kid's door will be in my station. But when the big hand points down...
...the door will be gone. You have until then to put the kid back. Get the picture?
If you could make that out to Bethany, my daughter...
Ah, yes! Let's see.... From your scary friend... Best wishes...
...so then I said, "if you talk to me like that again, we're through."
You know my mom. She sent me to my room.
See you guys later. Take it easy.
Oh. Well, hello there. What's your name?
Oh. Well, hello there. What's your name?
Oh, Sulley! ( then he scans the bathroom ) Okay, Sulley. Come on, enough. ( he sees George and Charlie ) Hey! You guys seen Sulley anywhere?
Boy, Wazowski looks like he's in trouble.
Sulley! Oh! Great news, pal. I got us a way out of this mess, but we gotta hurry. Where is it?
Sull, that's a cube of garbage. ( He spots the eye stalk. ) Uh-oh.
I can still hear her little voice.
Hey, I can hear her too.
How many kids you got in there?
Boo! Oh, you're alright. I was so worried. I was-- ( suddenly stern ) Don't you ever run away from me again, young lady. ( back to mushy ) Oh, but I'm so glad you're safe.
Uh, actually, she's my, uhh, my cousin's sister's--
Okay, Sulley, that's enough. Let's go.
Yeah, yeah, yeah, sure. Step aside, kid. We're in a--
Will you stop makin' Boo laugh?!
I still don't understand. You've got Boo's door?
Okay, let's move. Let's move, let's move! Come on!
Oh, please be there, please be there, please be there.
There it is! Just like Randall said!
1, 2, 3, 4! Get the kid back through the door!
We're gonna get our lives back. The nightmare is over.
Hey, what's the matter? C'mon, it's time to move.
Mike, what are you thinkin'? We can't trust Randall. He's after Boo.
Who cares? Let's go. This is a limited time offer.
No, no. I don't like this.
Look, Sulley, you wanted her door, and there it is. Now, let's move!
You want me to prove everything's on the up and up? Fine! ( He storms toward Boo's door. ) He wants the door; I get the door. He doesn't want it now.
Paranoid delusional furball. ( He opens the door and goes inside. )
Hey, Sulley, where have you been all day? ( as Sulley runs past ) Sulley?
Mike? Mike? Where are you? You in there? Where are you, buddy? Mike?
Um, so to confirm, then, you did find the ah...
Oh, huzzah! That's great news. N-n-not that I was concerned of course, I knew--
Just get over here and help me!
Come on, come on, come on! While we're young here, Fungus!
Kid needs to take off a few pounds.
Wazowski! Where is it, ya little one-eyed crettin?!
Okay. First of all, it's cretin. If you're gonna threaten me, do it properly. Second of all, you're nuts if you think kidnapping me is gonna help you cheat your way to the top!
You still think this is about that stupid scare record?
Well... I did. Right up until... you chuckled like that... and, uh, now I'm thinkin' I should just get outta here.
I'm about to revolutionize the scaring industry. And when I do, even the "great" James P. Sullivan's gonna be working for me.
Well, somebody's certainly been a busy bee.
First I need to know where the kid is, and you're gonna tell me.
I-I don't! I mean, I don't.... Uh-oh.
What's that? Wait. Come on. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Oh, come on. No, no, no, no, no, no. Come on. Hey, hey, hey, hey. This thing is moving.
I don't like big, moving things that are moving towards me. No! Come on! Hey! Randall!
Say hello to the scream extractor.
Come on. Where are you goin'? We-we'll talk. Come on, we'll have a latte. Come on. We can talk about this.
What's that thing? What is that thing? Wait, wait, wait! No, no, no! Uh-oh! No! Come on, hey!
Oh, for.... what did you do wrong this time?
I don't know. I calibrated the drive shaft--
There must be something wrong with the scream intake valve. That's the problem with these 3250 units...
Psst. Fungus. Fungus! You like cars? Huh? 'Cause I got a really nice car. If you let me go, I'll give you... a ride in the car. Please, Fungus?
I'm sorry, Wazowski, but Randall said I'm not allowed to fraternize with victims of his evil plot.
This is crazy. He's gonna kill us!
We gotta get out of here now! We can start a whole new life somewhere far away! Goodbye, Monsters, Inc.! Goodbye, Mr. Waternoose!
Follow me. I have an idea.
No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no!
What was that? You're trying to scare the kid, not lull it to sleep!
I was going for a snake/ninja approach with a little hissing. ( hisses )
How many times do I have to tell you? It's all about PRESENCE! About how you enter the room!
No, no, no, no. Sir, you don't understand!
Ah, now, show these monsters how it's done.
I can't... Sir, sir, you have to listen to me!
Pay attention, everyone. You're about to see the best in the business.
Now, give us a big, loud roar.
Mr. Waternoose, there's no time for this!
Come on, come on, what are you waiting for? Roar!
I hope you learned a valuable lesson in scaring today. Read chapters 2 and 3 in your manuals. I'll see you all in the morning.
I hope you learned a valuable lesson in scaring today. Read chapters 2 and 3 in your manuals. I'll see you all in the morning.
Sir, she isn't toxic. I know it sounds crazy but trust me.
Boo? No, no, no, no. It's okay. I was just...
Oh, no, no, no, no, no, don't be scared. That wasn't real. It's just a... I was just...
...this scream machine and he was gonna test it out on that sweet, little girl.
Now that we have her, he is trying to kill us! This whole thing is Randall's fault!
Yes. And we can take you to his secret lab, which is right here in this factory.
How could this happen? Oh, how could this happen? Does anyone else know about this?
Good. This company can't afford any more bad publicity. Now, before we do anything else, let's...take care of the child.

Oh, I never thought things would come to this, not in my factory. I'm sorry you boys got mixed up in this. Especially you, James. But now we can set everything straight again, for the good of the company.
Uh, sir, that's not her door.
No! No! NO, NO, NO, NO, NO!!!

It's too late! We're BANISHED, genius!! We're in the HUMAN WORLD!!! Oh, what a great idea; goin' to your old pal Waternoose! Too bad he was in on the whole thing! All you hadda do, was listen to me. JUST ONCE!!! But you DIDN'T, did you?!

Abominable! (chuckles) Can you believe that? Do I look abominable to you? Why can't they call me the Adorable Snowman, or... or the Agreeable Snowman, for cryin' out loud? I'm a nice guy. (offering) Snow cone?
Oh, no, no, no. Don't worry. It's lemon. (to Sulley) How 'bout you, big fella? Snow cone?
Did you see the way she... looked at me?

Ah, poor guy. I understand. It ain't easy bein' banished. Take my buddy, Bigfoot. When he was banished, he fashioned an enormous diaper out of poison ivy. (chuckles) Wore it on his head like a tiara. Called himself "King Itchy".
It won't be so hard for you guys, though, you know, I mean, how lucky can you get? Banished with your best friend.
Oh, I just assumed you were buddies, you know, when I saw you out there in the snow huggin' and all that...
Look at that big jerk. Ruined my life, and for what? A STUPID KID!!! Because of YOU, I am now STUCK in this frozen wasteland!

Wasteland? I think you mean "Wonderland"! I mean, how 'bout all this fabulous snow, huh? Oh, and wait 'til you see the local village - cutest thing in the world. I haven't even mentioned all the free yak's milk...
Uh, yak's milk. Milkin' a yak ain't exactly a picnic, but you know, once you pick the hairs out, it's very nutritious.
No, no! Something about a village! Where?! Are there kids in it?!
Kids? Sure. Tough kids, sissy kids, kids who climb on rocks...
Hey. It's at the bottom of the mountain. Around a three-day hike.
Ugh, three days?! We need to get there NOW!!!
You wanna go to the village? OK, rule number one out here: Always …no. Never go out in a blizzard.
We need to get to Boo.
Ever since that kid came in, you've ignored everything I've said, and NOW look where we are! Oh, we were about to break the record, Sulley! We would've had it made!
None of it matters? Wa-wa-wait a second. " None of it matters"?
Okay, that's - no. Good. Great. So now the truth comes out, doesn't it?
Oh, ho, would you look at that? We're out of snow cones. Let me... just go outside and make some more.
Sulley, what about everything we ever worked for? Does that matter? Huh? What about Celia? I am never... never gonna see her again. Doesn't that matter?
And what about me? I'm your pal, I'm-I'm-I'm your best friend. Don't I matter?
I'm sorry, Mike. I'm sorry we're stuck out here. I didn't mean for this to happen. But Boo's in trouble. I think there might be a way to save her, if we can just get down to that--
"We"? Whoa, whoa, whoa. "We"? No. There's no "we" this time, pal. If-if-if you wanna go out there and freeze to death, you be my guest. Because you're on your own.
Hey, I got more snow cones!
Oh, come on, now, George. I know you can do this. I picked out an easy door for you, in Nepal. Nice, quiet Nepal.
You know, you're right. Here, take this.
What the--? Hey! You can't just-
Finally! I never should have trusted you with this. Because of you, I had to banish my top scarer!
Eh, with this machine, we won't need scarers. Besides, Sullivan got what he deserved.
Sullivan was TWICE the scarer you'll ever be!
You don't know how long I've wanted to do that, Sullivan!
Look, it's not that I don't care about the kid.
Yes, I do. I was just mad, that's all. I needed some time to think, but you shouldn't have left me out there.
No, I'm not attacking you. I'm tryna be honest, just hear me out. Look, you and I are a team. Nothin' is more important than our friendship.
I-I know, kid. He's too sensitive.
Come on, pal, if you start cryin', I'm gonna cry, and I'll never get through this.
I'm sorry I wasn't there for you, but I am now.
Hey, Sulley, I am baring my soul here. The least you can do is pay attention!
Hey, look at that, it's Randall. It's... Oh.
GET UP! There can't be any witnesses!
I'm glad you came back, Mike.
Somebody's gotta take care of ya, ya big hairball.
Michael, if you don't tell me what's going on right now, we are through! Do you hear me? Through!

Okay, here's the truth! You know that kid that they're lookin' for? Sulley let her in! We tried to send her back, but Waternoose had this secret plot, and now Randall's right behind us, and he's trying to kill us!
YOU EXPECT ME TO BELIEVE THAT PACK OF LIES, MIKE WAZOWSKI?!
Will you move it?! Look out, you... idiots!!!
Look out. Comin' through here! Comin' through! Make way. Move it!
Attention, employees: Randall Boggs has just broken the all-time scare record!
Huh? No, I didn't! Get out of my way!
Way to go, Randall! Nice job!
Get off my tail! Let me through!
We have to get Boo's door and find a station.
What a plan. Simple, yet insane!
I'm gonna be sick, I'm gonna be sick! Whoaaaaa! Oh, no!
There it is! How are we supposed to get to it now?!
Oh, it's a dead end, Sulley!
Why couldn't we get banished here?
Come on, we gotta find another door!
There he is! Hurry! Hurry up!
Come on, it slides, it slides!
I hope that hurt, lizard boy!
Great job, buddy! We lost him!
Sulley, what are you doing? Sulley!
Looks like we caught the express, pal!
Look at everybody's favorite scarer now, you stupid, pathetic waste!
You've been Number One for too long, Sullivan! Now your time is up!
And don't worry. I'll take good care of the kid!
She's not scared of you anymore.
Looks like you're out of a job.
All right, come on, over the plate, let's see the old stuff here, pal. Come on, now, chuck him, chuck him, baby, hum, baby. Hum, baby. Here's the pitch...
NO, NO, WAIT! PLEASE! DON'T! DON'T! DON'T!
Mama, another gator got in the house.
Another gator?! Gimme that shovel! Come here!
Get him, mama! Get that gator!
Care to do the honors, Mikey?
That's right, Boo. You did it! You beat him.
Care to do the honors, Mikey?
That's right, Boo. You did it! You beat him.
Okay, Boo, it's time to go home. Take care of yourself and be a good girl, okay?
The power's out. Make her laugh again.
All right, I got a move here. It'll bring down the house. Up!
What?! What'd you do, forget to check if her stupid hood was up, ya big dope?!
Uncle Mike, try not to yell in front of her. You know we still need her to laugh.
Right. Hey Boo, just kiddin'. Look!
Funny, right? See, with the... These are the jokes, kid.
When the door lands in this station, cut the power. You'll have the child, and the criminals responsible for this whole mess.
Great. A welcoming committee! What are we gonna do?
This is the CDA. Come out slowly with the child in plain sight.
Okay, okay! You got us. Here we are. Here's the kid. I'm cooperatin'. But before you take us away, I have one thing to say:
23-19! We have a toxic projectile! Isolate the contaminate!
Cover the area! Bring in reinforcements!
Don't let THEM GET AWAY! WHAT...?!
NO, WAIT, WAIT! COME BACK! He has the child!
SULLIVAN! SULLIVAN! GIVE ME THE CHILD!
Open this door! OPEN THIS DOOR!
I think we stopped him, Boo. You're safe now. You be a good girl, okay?
This has gone far enough, James.
She's home now! Just leave her alone!
I can't do that! She's seen too much. You both have.
It doesn't have to be this way.
I have no choice! Times have changed! Scaring isn't enough anymore!
I'll kidnap a THOUSAND children before I let this company die, and I'll SILENCE ANYONE WHO GETS IN MY WAY!
Good night, mom. Good night, mom.
What, wh-what is this? What? Who? Huh?
Well, I don't know about the rest of you guys, but I spotted several big mistakes.
You know what? Let's watch my favorite part again, shall we?
I'll kidnap a THOUSAND children before I let this company die! I'll kidnap a THOUSAND children before I let this company die! I'll kidnap a THOUSAND children before I let this company die!
I'll get him. Alright, come with us, sir.
Wh-what are you doing?! Take your hands off me! You can't arrest me!
I hope you're happy, Sullivan! You destroyed this company! Monsters Incorporated is dead! Where will everyone get their scream now?! The energy crisis will only get worse, because of you!
Stay where you are. Number One wants to talk to you.

Two and a half years of undercover work were almost wasted when you intercepted that child, Mr. Sullivan. Of course, without your help, I never would have known that this went all the way up to Waternoose.
I just wanna send her home.
Very good. Bring me a door shredder.
What, you mean... You mean, I can't see her again?
That's the way it has to be. I'll give you five minutes.
Uh... Boo... um... Oh, look at that. Yeah, you know-- Oh, that's cute. Yeah... uh... Boo...
Nothing's coming out of the closet to scare you anymore. Right?
None of this ever happened, gentlemen. And I don't wanna see any paperwork on this.
I bet we get the rest of the day off.
YOU IDIOT! They're gonna shut down the factory!
I'm tellin' ya, pal, when that wall went up, you should've seen the look on Waternoose's face. Hoo-hoo! I hope we get a copy of that tape.

Hey, you alright? Come on, pal, cheer up. We did it! We got Boo home. Ah, sure we put the factory in the toilet, and... gee, hundreds of people will be outta work now. Not to mention the angry mob that'll come after us when there's no more power, but hey! At least we had some laughs, right?
Hey, is this thing on? Hello. Hello. Testing, testing.
Hey, good evening, how are you? Nice to see you. I'll tell you, it's great to be here in... your room. Where are you from?
Never mind. You're in kindergarten, right? Oh, I love kindergarten. Best three years of my life.
of my life. But I love sports. Dodge-ball was the best. Oh, yeah, I was the fastest one out there. Of course I was the ball...
...but I... was the ball... see? All right.
Hey, thanks a lot! I'll be here all week. Remember to tip your waitresses.
Great job, Mikey. You filled your quota on the first kid of the day.
Not bad, huh? You know, only somebody with perfect comedic timing could produce this much energy in one shot.
Uh-huh. And the fact that laughter is ten times more powerful than scream had nothing to do with it?
Oh, Googly Bear...! Come here, you!
Girls, girls! Ple- stop, stop, stop. Michael, you're such a charmer.
Hey, did you bring the magazine?
They just delivered a whole box.
Let me see it! Ha ha ha! Sulley and I made the cover, right?
Girls, girls! Ple- stop, stop, stop. Michael, you're such a charmer.
Hey, did you bring the magazine?
They just delivered a whole box.
Let me see it! Ha ha ha! Sulley and I made the cover, right?
I'm on the cover of a maga- zine! OW!!
Ah! Hey, uh, Mike. I was, uh...
Well, listen, if you got a minute, there's something I wanna show you. Okay? Close your eyes, follow me.
Keep coming, keep coming, keep coming. Come on, keep coming, keep coming...
Come on, and follow the sultry sound of my voice. Okay, stop. Open 'em.
Sorry it took so long, pal. There was a lot of wood to go through. You know, it only works if you have every piece.
♪ If I were a rich man... ♪
♪ in a room... with a view. ♪
♪ It can happen. ♪ Both dreams do come true... ♪
♪ I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have you. ♪
♪ Wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... ♪
♪ Wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... ♪
Okay, you're finished now, right? Hello?
Come on, get lost, you two. You're makin' him lose his focus.
We're never gonna work in Hollywood again!
Oh, let me do it over!
Hey, thanks, guys, that was a close one.
What? What did I say? What? What?
Hey, how was that? Was I scary? Do I get the part?
Can I do it again? I can be taller!
Okay, let's move. Let's move, let's move! Come on!
Oh, please be there, please be...
Could we get a little more wax on the floor, please?
Wait a minute? Randall? That cheater! He's trying to boost his numbers.
I think you mean "Ook-lay in the ag-bay".
Well, you know, maybe you should just take a minute and "eedray your iptscray".
You think he's gonna come through the closet and scare ya. Oh, boy, how do I explain this? Uh, it's empty. See?
Okay, very funny. Hey, I look good in a suit.
Whoa! Shut it off! Shut it off! Pull the lever!
♪ But I must admit it, big guy, you always come through. I wouldn't have nothing if I didn't have you. ♪
♪ You and me together, that's how it always should be. One without the other don't mean nothing to me, nothing to me! ♪

Oh, hey! We're rehearsing a, a scene for the upcoming company play called, um, Put That Thing Back Where It Came From, or So Help Me! Heh, heh... it's a musical! ♪ Put that thing back where it came from, or so help me... ♪
♪ Get that thing away from me, you guy, Put that thing back where it came from, or I'll poke myself in the eye! ♪ Heh heh. It's a work in progress, it's gonna get better.
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to this year's company play. Starring, written, and directed by Mike...
♪ Put that thing back where it came from, or so help me! ♪

lines.character: MIKE, SULLEY, GEORGE, JOSH, AND GREEN CYCLOPS
lines.text: ♪ Put that thing back where it came from, or so help me! ♪ So help me!
Your seat is right over there, sir.
♪ There's a child! There's a child! There's a human child! ♪
♪ Running 'round the restaurant, this is really wild! ♪
♪ What in heaven's name will become of us? ♪
♪ We who are living in Monstropolis! ♪
Alright, Wazowski! Tell us where the kid is????
♪ And just when I dare to care, she says "Au contraire, you're my pair of friends... I love you." ♪
♪ And so we put that kid back where she came from, because she helped us to find... a better tomorrow today! ♪♪
Thank you! What a night for my mother to be in the audience, ladies and gentlemen! My mom!
♪ I don't have to say it. ♪

♪ Both know it's true. I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... you. ♪
I'm gonna anyway!/Where'd everybody come from?
♪ But we both know it's true! ♪
Let's take it home, big guy!
♪ I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... ♪
♪ I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't ha
(v.o.) I'm gonna anyway!/Where'd everybody come from?
(v.o.) ♪ But we both know it's true! ♪
(v.o.) Let's take it home, big guy!
(v.o.) ♪ I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... ♪
(v.o.) ♪ I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... I wouldn't have nothin' if I didn't have... ♪
(v.o.) ♪ You. You! You! A-E-I-O that means you! ♪♪

director: Pete Docter, David Silverman, Lee Unkrich
